intro: Thlaspi firmiense, commonly known as the rock白菜 or rock mustard, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is typically found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Thlaspi firmiense is known for its ability to tolerate harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in mountainous regions. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution across various rocky habitats.
